title: Document Embedding Issues
body:
I recently posted [something in the boards](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/fancreations/V7Y7jAEc-flight-of-the-nautilus) that includes a document as a link.  While the embedding feature is great, it can be inefficient when linking something akin to a Google Doc.

Now instead of formatting, I just have the document itself embedded into the post, which is not what I wanted.  Any ideas on solutions, or whether or not there are any?

Screenshot attached for clarity.

replies.body: Hmm that one is a bit tricky. We are going to be rolling out a fix soon that will let you link to content without it auto-embedding which should help this. We could probably fix the treatment that google docs embeds get as well, but that will take a bit more time. Thanks for reporting this!

Awesome, thank you very much for the info!  It's great to know that you're at least working on it, regardless of duration.

By the way, links in comments *do not* auto-embed.  Not sure if you could cross some of that functionality to actual post content, but thought it might be worth knowing.

> Hmm that one is a bit tricky. We are going to be rolling out a fix soon that will let you link to content without it auto-embedding which should help this. We could probably fix the treatment that google docs embeds get as well, but that will take a bit more time. Thanks for reporting this!

Yay! Thanks!
